paragraphs.value:
My name is Luigi Zheng Simiani (郑彼洋), currently 23, and I am a photographer based in Amsterdam.

Before arriving in Amsterdam, I lived on a small island off the coast of Malaysia called Penang. Therefore, much of my photography can be interpreted as a reaction to the culture shock I initially experienced moving to the city.

Before arriving in Amsterdam, I lived on a small island off the coast of Malaysia called Penang. Therefore, much of my photography can be interpreted as a reaction to the culture shock I initially experienced moving to the city.

My photographic journey started with street photography, as I attempted to make sense of the chaos unfolding in the city, with my off-camera flash. On the street, I seek to capture rare moments that happen once in a lifetime, so I rarely interrupt my subjects, as I would not want to alter those beautiful yet fleeting moments of life.

During my university years studying politics, I saw the underground music scene as an escape from the mundane tasks assigned to us at school. People wore extravagant outfits and expressed themselves freely at these events, ultimately making fashion and music a focus of my documentation.

If my work intrigues you, let's get in touch and create imagery that leaves an impression...
